title: The Industrial Revolution
key_facts: Transition to new manufacturing processes in Europe and the United States.
Shift from hand production methods to machines and factories.
Rise of mechanized textile production and the iron industry.
causes: Agricultural Revolution leading to surplus food and population growth.
Availability of natural resources like coal and iron ore.
Scientific innovation and the invention of the steam engine.
Colonial trade networks providing raw materials and markets.
outcome: Establishment of industrial capitalism as the dominant global economic system.
Transition into the Second Industrial Revolution (electricity, steel) by the mid-19th century.

figures.name: James Watt
figures.role: Inventor who improved the steam engine, powering the revolution.

figures.name: Eli Whitney
figures.role: Inventor of the cotton gin; popularized interchangeable parts.

figures.name: Karl Marx
figures.role: Philosopher who critiqued the social impact of industrial capitalism.

impacts: Massive shift of population from rural areas to cities (urbanization).
Rise of a new middle class (bourgeoisie) and working class (proletariat).
Acceleration of European imperialism and colonialism.
